headline: Student & Tinkerer

jobPositions.title: ARC
jobPositions.description:
Technical Lead for ARC, a student-run organization dedicated to encouraging a deep passion for education in young students through free tutoring classes, summer camps, and contests. 
- Co-founder and event organizer
- Main website developer

projects.title: MCPI++
projects.description: Source partially available due to copyright MCPI++ is a fork of the MCPI-Reborn mod. It's a modding platform for the aging video game "Minecraft: Pi Edition", designed to bring the game up to date with support for new OSes and a plethora of mods to make the game more enjoyable for beginners and veterans alike. It is written in primarily C++.

projects.title: ZipShip
projects.description: Open source Tech stack - Javascript/Discord bot API, Phython, Flask ZipShip is an innovative shipping optimizer. It finds the quickest and fastest ways to ship any given package to any destination on the globe, while reducing carbon emissions along the way. ZipShip was made in 48 hours for the TriHacks hackathon and won the first place prize.

Open source A joke operating system themed on the popular video game "Among Us". Built on top of the Debian GNU/Linux distro with custom theming and tweaks. This project was made in collaboration with another developer. It's received millions of engagements across the internet, and continues to be a fan-favourite meme within the Linux community.
projects.title: AmogOS

projects.description: Open source Tech stack - JavaScript, ReactJS, Supabase, Cloudflare Pages This project was a small leaderboard system made for the purposes of learning JavaScript. It was made for the Build-A-Bot booth at the Calgary stampede, in order to log down and display hundreds of score submissions in real-time. It features an internal staff-only page for submitting scores, which is then written to a Supabase store and read back by the main leaderboard, pulling real-time updates for hundreds of entries via a subscriber.
projects.title: Build-A-Bot
Duinotize
projects.description: Open source A new alternative to ads. Duinotize is a website monetizer, powered by Duino Coin, a cryptocurrency designed to be run on low-power devies like Arduinos. Ads are annoying and intrusive, but Duinotize runs completely in the background, using minimal amounts of energy and computer resources. It's easy to setup and manage for passive income, unlike programs such as AdSense. It is made with vanilla JavaScript.

Open source Tech stack - Python, sqlalchemy, railway.app, FastAPI, Vue.js, tailwindcss, and Github Pages MoneyBuddy is a financial assistance tool that makes you financially smarter, instead of working harder. By answering a quick survey, MoneyBuddy calculates a financial index score for you, shows how your spending habits compares to others, and shows ways you can save more money and increase your wealth. It was a hackathon project made in 48 hours for the OneHacksII hackathon.
projects.title: MoneyBuddy

projects.description: Open source A port of the popular "8-puzzle" game to the Sprig console platform by Hack Club. This specific port takes inspiration from "Exponential Idle". It is written in vanilla JavaScript.
projects.title: 8-Sprig
Amphibia: Calamity Beatdown (contributor)
projects.description: Open source Amphibia: Calamity Beatdown is a fan made side-scrolling platformer/beat 'em up based on the popular cartoon. Sort of like the pixel styled Themesong Takeover video. Grab up to 3 friends, choose your favorite amphibian or calamity girl, and take on the wilds of Amphibia! Developed in Godot Engine.

projects.title: Pi-Apps (Contributor)
projects.description: Open source Tech stack - Bash Pi-Apps is an app store for the Raspberry Pi ecosystem of SBCs running Linux. Pi-Apps puts the power of desktop computing in the hands of its users, allowing apps never supported before to work, while bringing attention to smaller, lesser-known yet still valuable pieces of niche software. Pi-Apps has millions of public downloads and it is commonly used by teachers in educational environments.

projects.title: Cardio Pulmonary Revolution
projects.description: Open source Cardio Pulmonary Revolution is a project meant to educate individuals on how to properly perform CPR. It was made in partnership with another developer. It consists of a CPR dummy with integrated load cells that triggers circuits when enough pressure is applied, turning into cursor clicks. These actions are then used to play a rhythm game, ensuring that subjects train on applying enough pressure during CPR while also have a enjoyable experience.

awards.name: Robotics Tournament Champions
awards.description:
- Previously served as lead programmer on VRC team 2088S, which won the Vex 2023-2024 Over Under Alberta Provincial Championship in addition to the overall Excellence Award, thus qualifying for the VEX World Championship.
- Team 2088S also won a regional robot skills award earlier in the season.

awards.name: TriHacks
awards.description: - Awarded the 1st place prize out of 130 participants for ZipShip, a shipping and logistics optimization tool that optimizes cost, speed, and environmental impact

- Awarded 3rd place out of 20 teams at the Youreka Calgary regional symposium for research regarding statistical analyses of water contamination in Canada. 
- Finalists for the Youreka National symposium.
awards.name: Youreka Symposium
Waterloo Math Contests
awards.description:
- Awarded the certificate of distinction for ranking in the top 25% out of 14,918 participants for the CIMC math contest.
- Previously also awarded the Certificate of Distinction for the Pascal math contest in 2022.

- 3rd place recipient of the (national) Canada Wide Science Fair.
- 1st place winner of the Calgary Youth Science Fair.
awards.name: Science Fair
